title: [AB Testing] Full team
body:
You are invited to run an AB **test session** on datasets uploaded in **Recognai WorkSpace**.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1v3Fn-106BPVyRBwnRUl-hO-cuzspUYWtzVeI73UI508

The aim is to compare Annotation buttons style, get qualitative feedback and metrics to decide which view is working better.
It's also a way to start organizing testing session and do it regularly one time we fin a good rutine to do it.

@david upload 2 datasets with **your name**, use it, and **don't forget to add the a piece of text**  _&UXtest=fixed_ at the end of the url to reach the B view.

1. domain_abtest_amelie 
2. banking_abtest_amelie


In total you will need 40 minutes to test (2X20) + 5 minutes of preparation and 10 of feedback. 
So in 1 hour you will make it.

We have **until next friday 17th** to complete the test.

Thank you, and let me know if you have questions!

title: Add conda installation option for rubrix
body:
Add a `conda` installation option for `rubrix`. I have already stared working on this one. It has passed all the CI's and will soon be merged. Once the :bulb: [**PR**][#pr-conda-forge-rubrix] gets approved/merged, `rubrix` will be available on conda-forge as:

[#pr-conda-forge-rubrix]: https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/17234

```sh
conda install -c conda-forge rubix
```

:zap: Once `rubrix` is available on `conda-forge`, I will push a PR to update the readme-installation section.

title: Issue SSL Certificate for Rubrix
body:
Background:  
I'm running Rubrix on a server to be accessed by multiple annotators in my organization.  I would like to forward it so that all users can log in by accessing the right internal website when connected to VPN.   I am running Rubrix via docker-compose.

Problem: 
I need to serve Rubrix with a SSL certificate to ensure a security of users.

Is currently a way to do this?  I'm not seeing anything in the documentation.

Thanks!

title: [Token classification] Single validation for records with no annotation and prediction info fails

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
Given a set of records logged in rubrix without annotation and prediction:

```python
import rubrix as rb 

text = "This is a text"
dataset = "empty-records-for-token-classification"

records = [rb.TokenClassificationRecord(text=text, tokens=text.split(), metadata={"example": i}) for i in range(0,10)]
rb.log(records, name=dataset)
```

And validate "as is" from UI raise an UI error:
![Screenshot 2021-12-02 at 15 35 51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2518789/144442548-45dc84d7-42a9-4504-b9ec-a434f8f3346c.png)

When one has spacy<3.0 installed, the import of Rubrix fails. Maybe it would be best to move the imports of the "optional" dependencies to local imports in the corresponding class. This would concern the `labeling`, `metrics` and `monitor` modules. @frascuchon what do you think?

```python
import rubrix as rb

# output
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ImportError                               Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-1-2845e3dc1a19> in <module>
----> 1 import rubrix as rb

~/recognai/rubrix/src/rubrix/__init__.py in <module>
     30 from rubrix.client import RubrixClient
     31 from rubrix.client.models import *
---> 32 from rubrix.monitoring.model_monitor import monitor
     33 
     34 try:

~/recognai/rubrix/src/rubrix/monitoring/model_monitor.py in <module>

      4 
----> 5 from ._spacy import Language, ner_monitor
      6 from ._transformers import Pipeline, huggingface_monitor
      7 

~/recognai/rubrix/src/rubrix/monitoring/_spacy.py in <module>

---> 11     from spacy import Language
     12     from spacy.tokens import Doc
     13 except ModuleNotFoundError:

ImportError: cannot import name 'Language' from 'spacy' (/home/david/miniconda3/envs/rubrix/lib/python3.8/site-packages/spacy/__init__.py)
```

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

title: feat(server): allow handle labeling rules for datasets from API
body:
This PR includes dataset labeling rules management for API.

- Following the API rule data model:

LabelingRule | Data model for labeling rules creation
-- | --
query* | The rule es query
label* | The linked rule label
description | Description related to rule

- Rules are keyed by query, we cannot include rules with same query

@dcfidalgo @dvsrepo  Feedback welcome


See #745

title: CreationTokenClassificationRecord raises misaligned entity mention error exception for edge cases

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
Given the input: 

```
input_dict = {'annotation': TokenClassificationAnnotation(agent='heuristics', entities=[EntitySpan(start=22, end=43, label='COMPANY', score=1.0)], score=None),
 'text': 'according to analysts.\n     Dart Group Corp was not',
 'tokens': ['according', 'to', 'analysts', '.', '\n     ', 'Dart', 'Group', 'Corp', 'was', 'not']}
```

A call to `CreationTokenClassificationRecord.check_annotation(**input_dict)` will trigger:

```
AssertionError: Defined offset [
     Dart Group Corp] is a misaligned entity mention
```

Under closer inspection at `pdb.runcall( CreationTokenClassificationRecord.check_annotation, **input_dict)` , this happens because the `check_annotation` method fails to recognize that `\n     Dart Group Corp` and `Dart` start with the same token if newline and whitespace characters are ignored.

title: [Tutorials] Normalizing the tutorials

labels.name: type: documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

body:
As discussed in slack I did a quick preliminary analysis.

### Data set sizes

These are the tutorials and the data sets used in each one of them, plus their sizes.
- *(< possible)* means that we can easily reduce the size (i would suggest via the datasets streaming feature) without compromising the tutorial
- *(< not possible)* means that a reduction of the data set would alter the results/purpose of the tutorial.

In my opinion, up to 30MB for a data set is fine. If we set the limit at 30MB, then no tutorial needs substantial change regarding the data set size.

##### How to label your data and fine-tune a sentiment classifier
- banking77: 1MB (< not possible)
##### Building a news classifier with weak supervision
  - ag_news: 30MB (< not possible)
##### Explore and analyze Spacy NER pipelines
  - gutenberg_time: 34MB (< possible)
  - imdb: 80MB (< possible)
##### Active learning with ModAL and scikit-learn
  - data shipped
##### Find label errors with cleanlab
  - mrpc: 1.5MB (< not possible)
##### Zero-shot Named Entity Recognition with Flair
  - wnut: <1MB (< possible)
##### Clean labels using your model loss
  - ag_news: 30MB (< not possible)
##### Monitor predictions in HTTP API endpoints
  - no data set used
##### Faster data annotation with a zero-shot
  - mlsum: 490MB (< possible)

### Normalizing structure

Here is my proposal for normalizing the tutorials:

- Heading: Title
- below the title a TDLR (without any extra heading), I imagine one or two summarizing phrases plus a bullet list of the tutorial's steps
- Picture/Diagram/Video
- Heading: Introduction (Optional, describing a bit the topic of the tutorial)
- Heading: Setup (Here, I would link to our GitHub repo, our Rubrix setup guide, install the tutorial's dependencies, do all the imports)
- The actual tutorial. Personally, I like commenting (nearly) every line of the code. When you look at our tutorials, the code snippets with their dark theme are very eye-catching, so often I find myself scrolling through the tutorial only looking at the code snippets (actually I often do the same for other blog posts/tutorials). So having a concise one-line comment is quite valuable in my oppinion.
- Heading: Summary (Optional, but I highly recommend it)
- Heading: Next steps (providing links to further resources)

There is still the issue of how to keep Screenshots/Videos up to date with our new releases, but not sure if we can fully automatize this ... regarding this issue, maybe I would prefer to put each tutorial in its separate folder together with all its media files, so it's very obvious what needs to be updated.

@dvsrepo @frascuchon

title: [Monitoring] Include auto monitor for flair ner models

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
```python
import rubrix as rb

from flair.data import Sentence
from flair.models import SequenceTagger

# load tagger
tagger = rb.monitor(SequenceTagger.load("flair/ner-english"), dataset="flair-example", sample_rate=1.0)

# make example sentence
sentence = Sentence("George Washington went to Washington")

# predict NER tags
tagger.predict(sentence) # This will include ner info in a rubrix dataset

# print sentence
print(sentence)
```

title: feat(metrics): improve common dataset metrics

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
This PR makes accesible basic common metrics `text_length` and `records_status` through python client.

- The `text_length` metric computes the input text distribution for the rubrix tasks.
- The `record_status` metric computes the record status distribution: `Default`, `Validated` and `Discarded` are the available status keys.

title: [Dataset records] delete dataset records

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
Sometimes we could clean a rubrix dataset. The current workflow should be load desired records and log in a new dataset and then delete the old dataset.

It would be nice a "delete by query" action to clean dataset records. What do you think @dvsrepo @dcfidalgo ?


## [UPDATE]

- Records deletion will be applied by the python client
- The new method/function will have the same signature as `rb.load`:
```python 
import rubrix as rb
...
rb.delete_records(
   name="my-dataset", 
   ids=[...],  # A list of record ids. If provided, `query` param will be ignored
   query="a query", # The query matching records
   discard_only=False, # If True, matched records won't be deleted. Instead of that, the matched records will be marked as `Discarded`
)
```
- Only super-users or dataset creators can delete records. Other users only can mark as `Discarded`, even if `discard_only` is set to `True`

title: [Dataset deletion] Allow select multiple datasets for deletion

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body: It could be nice to select multiple datasets from UI for deletion.

title: [Search] Make nested fields combination available through query string dsl

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
Extend basic query dsl (elasticsearch/lucene) to allow filter by nested fields combinations, like [KQL does](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/kibana/current/kuery-query.html#_nested_field_queries)
